title: Vukašin
text:
Vukašin (<a href="Cyrillic%20script">Cyrillic script</a>: Вукашин) is an old <a href="Slavs">Slavic</a> name of <a href="Serbs">Serbian</a> origin. It is composed from two words: Vuk (<a href="wolf">wolf</a>) and sin (<a href="son">son</a>), so it means sin vuka (son of wolf). In some places in Croatia and Bosnia it can be found as a surname.
The name Vukašin can be found in <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>, <a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>, <a href="North%20Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>, <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>, <a href="Republika%20Srpska">Republika Srpska</a> and <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a> (used by Serbs of Croatia). During <a href="sound%20change">sound change</a> <a href="phoneme">phoneme</a> <a href="S">S</a> became <a href="%C5%A1">š</a>.
